ygData.subject: Re: Running 2 heritrix
ygData.msgSnippet: You guess it right! I want 2 heritrix to run in my server. Before your solution, I was able to run 2 heritrix by installing a second heritrix and running it

You guess it right! I want 2 heritrix to run in my server. Before 
your sol=
ution, I was able to run 2 heritrix by installing a second 
heritrix and ru=
nning it using a different version of Java. Thank you 
very much for the he=
lp.

Regarding the RIS open error, I am using heritrix 1.6. I usually 
enco=
unter this error in authentication pages.

Regarding the politeness feature=
 of heritrix, is there any way around 
it since our crawls are sanctioned b=
y the webowners?

Thanks again in advance.




--- In archive-crawler@yahoo=
groups.com, stack <stack@a...> wrote:
>
> alxartes wrote:
> > Hope someone =
would answer the following inquiries.
> >
> > 1. How can we run 2 simultane=
ous crawls? We wanted to run 2 or 
multiple
> > crawls at the same time bec=
ause we are time constraint and have a 
lot
> > of web sites to crawl. We a=
lso wanted that each website has its 
own arc
> > file. I tried running a s=
econd heritrix at a different port but it
> > would not start up. How can I=
 do it?
> 
> I'm guessing you're asking about running two instances on the =
same 
> hardware and that you got an exception complaining about address 
a=
lready 
> in use?
> 
> Heritrix on a 1.5 JVM sets up listeners on two ports=
.  There is one 
> listening port for the web UI and then another listening=
 port for 
the 
> JMX Agent.
> 
> You can stipulate the web UI port from th=
e command line but 
specifying 
> the JMX port on the command line is a lit=
tle awkward because we're 
using 
> the JVM's JMX Agent.  The JVM's JMX Age=
nt takes its configuration 
as 
> java system properties passed on the comm=
and-line.  By the time the 
> Heritrix command-line processing goes into ef=
fect, the JVM's JMX 
Agent 
> configuration has been acted on (Later we'll =
put up our own JMX 
Agent. 
> Then it'll be possible to dictate as a comman=
d-line option to 
Heritrix 
> the port to listen on).
> 
> Meantime, you ne=
ed to use the JMX_PORT environment variable.  Here 
is 
> how you would run=
 two Heritrix instances on same hardware, one on 
> default ports of 8080 f=
or UI and 8849 for JMX Agent and the other 
with a 
> UI on port 8081 and i=
ts JMX Agent on 8850:
> 
> % ${HERITRIX_HOME}/bin/heritrix
> % JMX_PORT=3D8=
850 ${HERITRIX_HOME}/bin/heritrix --port=3D8081
> 
> If you're problem is o=
ther than the above, please paste in the 
exception 
> you got on crawl fai=
l (Check content of 
${HERITRIX_HOME}/heritrix_out.log).
> 
> >
> > 2. I al=
so noticed that in the console, only one thread is active 
most
> > of the =
time. Is this normal? I am worried because I have allerts 
like
> > https:/=
/guides-online.visitsingapore.com/tgls/loginProcess1.jsp 
RIS
> > still ope=
n. Should have been closed by method release: ToeThread 
#35:
> > https://g=
uides-online.visitsingapore.com/tgls/loginProcess1.jsp
(in 
> > <https://gu=
ides-online.visitsingapore.com/tgls/loginProcess1.jsp%
28in>
> > processor =
HTTP).
> >
> If you are using a single crawl to crawl a single site, yes, 
=
because the 
> crawler is trying to be 'polite'.  See '6.3.3.1. Politeness'=
 in the 
User 
> Manual, http://crawler.archive.org/articles/user_manual.ht=
ml.  See 
also 
> '7.1.2. Job Status Box' under the 'Load' section for disc=
ussion of 
why 
> only a few threads are running and 'Politeness' in the gl=
ossary.
> 
> Regards the 'RIS still open', which version of Heritrix are yo=
u 
using?
> 
> Thanks,
> St.Ack
